name: 13moons
review description: First time with coupon...this was the best restaurant ever to eat. The food was the best and well presented...the biggest rib-eye steak cooked to perfection.Halibut was great.It was just perfect, with seasonings..etc.The waitress was very pleasant and attentive.

name: 35th Street Bistro
review description: 35th Street Bistro delivers a wonderful, leisurely meal. Even the salads are remarkable.

name: 520 Bar & Grill
review description: Lots of locals... we're Canucks and snuck in or would that be sneaked?

name: A la bonne franquette
review description: Friendly service, beautiful view, cosy room, good food -- what more do you want?

name: Adriatic Grill - Italian Cuisine & Wine Bar
review description: After previously having a bad experience at the Adriatric Grill, I decided to give it a try again with a friend for lunch. We ate at the bar and the bartender served us. She was not that friendly, slow with service even though the bar was dead during lunch, didn't offer bread like the surrounding tables had, didn't refill our water, was slow to offer another alcoholic beverage (we were only on our first drink), and we had to wait forever for our check even though we asked for it twice and the waitress only had 1 other table! This is the second time I had a bad experience; really wanted to like the place but I probably won't go back. Bad service is a NO NO, especially when the server isn't busy. Worked in the restaurant biz for yrs NO EXCUSE

name: Agave Cocina & Cantina
review description: The food is generous and the wait staff very friendly.

name: Agave Cocina & Tequilas
review description: The food at Agave is very fresh and well presented; however, the flavors are bland and lacking authenticity. It is okay if you are not expecting Mexican or TexMex. The staff are great.

name: Al Boccalino
review description: lovely restaurant with an important chef - lovely

name: Altura
review description: Altura is an exceptional restaurant! This may sound untrue but they do everything right! The food is amazingly interesting, creative & DELICIOUS!, the staff (entire staff) work well together, each staff person is very knowledgeable about all menu items and wine list (of which there is an excellent & thoughtful selection).....they are always at the top of their game...we've never had a mediocre meal or experience at Altura.

name: Amante Pizza & Pasta - Capitol Hill
review description: The person who "greeted" me had no idea what open table was and made no effort to investigate after I tried to explain. I ordered coffee while I waited for a friend to join me. 20 minutes later it came! I cup of drip - 20 minutes. Then when we got the salads we ordered they were huge - way bigger than we could ever eat. She told us she made them big as a favor. It made me feel like I has wasted money by buying something to go with the salad since I assumed it would be the size it was described it in the menu. So poor service and a feeling I had wasted money be ordering an extra side. Not a good experience. She was nice and maybe trying to make up for the earlier lapses with the salad but it did not work.

name: Anchovies & Olives
review description: About our best dining experience on our Portland-Vancouver-Seattle trip. This place is a keeper!

name: Andaluca
review description: As always my most recent dinner was beyond compare. The ability to share exceptionally delightfully prepared and presented dishes and enjoy a conversation in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere though right downtown is exceptional in this loud, abrasive city today. Thank you for being here and please keep up the good work. Your new chef is delightful and very talented I would say.

name: Andiamo Bellevue
review description: Andiamo's always delivers a great dining experience. Service was exceptional even though there were a number of graduation groups that would create chaos in lesser establishments. The pasta was perfect. We will be back soon.

name: Annapurna Cafe
review description: My family and I have dined here several times and each and every time it has been great. Last time we ordered the lamb dish with the eggplant and I think it was one of the best dishes we have ever had. The staff is always friendly and many time we have ended up in conversation with the tables near us. Overall, I would definitely recommend Annapurna!

name: Anthony's HomePort
review description: Anthony's is always excellent. It's the perfect place to take friends and guests for perfect seafood.

name: Anthony's Pier 66
review description: Good food however, a little on the pricey side. Beautiful view from the second floor.

name: AQUA by El Gaucho
review description: This was our 4th visit. The food and service as expected were excellent!

name: Aqua Terra
review description: This was my first experience and I was not sure of what to expect but was pleasantly supprised. this is a gem located inside the Hotel and it offered a cozy brunch atmosphere to my delight since it was the Mother's Day brunch I brought my aunt to. I do not think they offer a brunch menu outsied of special days but i would recommend when they do that you be sure to enjoy. Food was fresh and well seasoned. Great Recommendation Open Table!

name: Arcadia
review description: Food was outstanding. A great find, didn't expect it to be that good. Nice menu selections.

name: Art Restaurant & Lounge at the Four Seasons Seattle
review description: As always, nicely presented, tasty, local foods with impeccable service.

name: Asado
review description: really noisy but food and service very good--wine steward needs a little work

name: Assaggio
review description: Have eaten here before and this time actually surpassed my last experience! EVERYTHING was great; food, service, price value, location and decor...right down to the WATER...(they bring a cute bottle of water) and fresh baked bread before you open your mounth to order drinks and dinner.

name: Bainbridge Thai Cuisine
review description: We were seated in a private area which was lovely. Main dining room is LOUD. View is lovely. Ferry ride over from Seattle is great and AWESOME after dinner. Food was delish, service was friendly and attentive. Great relaxed dinner with my family.

name: Barking Frog
review description: Our dinner experience there was very good. The great weather for eating outside helped. We arrived at the restaurant earlier than our reservation and they promptly sat us. Our server was very helpful and informative with our wine selection telling us a story of the winery which was local. I've had salmon at three different restaurants on this trip and the one at Barking Frog was the best by far.

name: Barolo
review description: Absolutely fabulous meal, great ambience, superb food and excellent service. Great last night to our holiday in the USA -found by luck on opentable.Well done all

name: Barrio - Capitol Hill
review description: Food is great, ambienece is great for those not stuck on table 60, as we were. This is the table you assign to walk-ins, not those with a reservation. Service is lacking for those fortunate enough to be sat at this table. The server was non existent, imagine watching all the tables around you getting great service while you are being ignored. This is what happens when you place a table in the middle of a walkway all by itself. Then to top that off, assign this table to a server in a completely different part of the restaurant. Yes service was awful, but I blame the restaurant's management for not paying attention to guests needs.

name: Basil's Kitchen
review description: THe singing was wonderful. The food just ok. A very limited menu, although at reasonable price. Wish the food had been better and the evening would have been outstanding.

name: Basil's Kitchen - Tukwila
review description: Food was outstanding and the staff was beyond outstsnding. Highly recomend the fish-n-chips and the french dip.

name: Beach Cafe
review description: Staff was not prepared to switch from breakfast to brunch menus. My breakfast order was cold when served. Service was slow and not attentive. Reserved table was not acceptable when offered. Requested a different table and was seated at a booth which was better.

name: BeachHouse bar + grill
review description: I took my girlfriend here for her birthday and we both had a great time! The food was amazing, and the staff was very friendly and helpful in making it a special night for her. They even set up a special table arrangement for us.

name: Bella Italia
review description: Everything about this place is great. The food is fresh the service is friendly the wine is delicious. Couldn't ask for more.

name: Bennett's Pure Food Bistro
review description: The food was disappointing - the pancakes and french toast burnt and heavy. They should also invest in a decent coffee machine. The coffee tastes watery.The food used to be excellent. Maybe it was the chef's day off.

name: Betty
address: 1507 Queen Anne Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
review description: After moving up to the top of Queen Anne nearly four months ago I've made the trip to Betty a handful of times and have been pleased with the service, drink list and service. They have a very good happy hour menu and $20 bottle wine menu. They are also one of the few places on Queen Anne that has a patio on the west side of the building allowing for some great outdoor dining on the days we get to enjoy the sun in Seattle.

name: Billy Bob's Burgers and BBQ
review description: Very interesting and eclectic menu. There are Argentine items on the menu that are authentic and taste great!

name: bin on the lake Wine Bar & Restaurant
review description: Have been here a couple of times, and the food is always good. But this time around the service was really sloppy. We didn't see our waitress until 10 minutes after we sat down, and it took nearly as long for her to come back after we were offered some bread to start. There were a number of other miscues I won't detail here, but the waitress seemed far too inexperienced for the menu they serve. Food was great, as always though.

name: Bistro Turkuaz
review description: Delicious, authentic food and very good service.

name: BITE Restaurant
review description: Bite at the Murano hotel, trendy and beautifully decorated hotel, has the look and atmosphere you can find in Miami or NYC . although the night we went was very quiet .. but Tacoma is quiet , no ?I had linguini & scallops, creamy ( a little bit too creamy) and rich in flavors . My husband has a kobe burger that he didn't enjoy .The berry sorbet was good . The overall experience was good .

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Federal Way
review description: The food and service were wonderful. We had a party of 10 for my mothers 70th birthday. Unfortunatly there was no special acknowledgment for my mom's birthday, our party sang happy birthday to her. The biggest problem was the restraunt was way to cold. It was 80 degrees outside and about 68 degrees inside, our whole party was bundled up. We asked if the AC could be turned down, the waitress said she would talk to the manager, not sure if she did or the manager did not want to reduce the AC. Every table sits under an air vent so there is no getting away from the breeze.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Lynnwood
review description: The employees always make it a priority to make sure the people dining have the most enjoyable dinner possible. Price is good.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Puyallup
review description: Wait person was excellent. Filet Mignon was overdone. Not the waitpersons fault at all.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Spokane
address: 14724 E Indiana Ave Spokane Valley, WA  99216
review description: Server was rude, didn't accept coupon I had from signing up for Black Angus Prime club for my birthday for a free dessert just because our meal already came with one.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Tacoma (Lakewood)
review description: We were promptly seated by the hostess and quickly greeted by our server. Drinks were generous and delicious. Food was well prepared and served in a friendly, timely manner. The server was attentive throughout and accurate in every aspect of of his service.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Yakima
review description: We were looking for something fast and not terrible. We got what we expected from this chain ... decent burgers with efficient service. Nothing spectacular but certainly a notch above the average burger joint.

name: Blackfish at Tulalip Resort Casino
review description: slightly above average for a main dining room. Very noisy.

name: Blossom Vegetarian
review description: We had the mango salad without the 'faux' ham and the lemongrass tofu.They were both extremely flavorful and delicious.The menus is AMAZING if you love 'faux' meat.And, of course, the people were amazingly kind and attentive.

name: Blue Star Cafe and Pub
review description: Great restaurant!!! Loved the food, drink and Tom the bartender.

name: Blueacre Seafood
review description: I have been a fan of Chef Kevin for many years, and his restaurants (he also owns the Steelhead Diner) continue to impress each time. Blueacre is my favorite of the two, for the food, service, and ambiance. A comfortable and expansive space, always featuring the very freshest seafood on a menu that changes daily, and lots of bargains for happy hour and (at least right now) three course fixed priced dinners. In a city where good seafood abounds, Blueacre continues to be the stand-out.

name: BluWater Bistro - Greenlake
address: 7900 E. Greenlake Dr. N. Seattle, WA  98103
review description: been here twice now - will not be going back. Food is ok...not great...perhaps not even good...but ok. That said, it certainly is not tasty enough to compensate for the poor service. My GF and I came to the conclusion after two visits that it isn't a matter of being lazy or not caring...they aren't "bad" service people...they are incompetent in the most objective sense of the word, without bias or prejudice. They simply do not know their jobs - they do not know what they are doing. My guess is that the restaurant hires inexperienced staff, and also has a high turnover...

name: BluWater Bistro - Leschi
review description: Great for any event. Have been there on many occasions and always excited to go back

name: BOKA Restaurant + Bar
review description: My wife and I love coming here, the food is fresh, organic and local. The drinks are also amazing. The service is very good. We love going here because its a great price for the amazing food. Valet parking is free.

name: Boom Noodle - Bellevue Square
review description: Met a collegue for lunch food was great and was not so noisy i couldn't hear him across the table. we had a good time and the server was great!

name: Boom Noodle - Capitol Hill
review description: really fun and yummy. nice staff. super food.

name: Boom Noodle - University Village
review description: Food was really really good as always!

name: Branzino Restaurant
review description: this is by far one of the best dinner experiences my wife and I have had in ages. perfect on every level and we would recommend to anyone!

name: Bremerton Bar & Grill
review description: Overall experience was satisfactory. We had a reservation and got seated on time. Quality of the food was ok, nothing to write home about. One of the three brunch orders was incorrect, the waiter got it wrong as he was new and didn't write it down. My son ate it anyway as he was hungry and we had a ferry to catch as we were on our way to a baseball game. We will go back and give it another try.

name: Brix 25 Restaurant
review description: We have been to Brix 25 several times over the years for special occasions and had fabulous meals and experienced service. This time, however, the food was very good but missed the mark of fabulous. Server was young and lacked experience and confidence.

name: The Brooklyn Seafood, Steak & Oyster House
review description: Entrees are good as usual, but was disappointed with the bread service that you have to pay for - not commonly seen in other fine dining restaurants that we've been to. When the price of the entrees are in the $30 price range, I'm sure the restaurant can throw in some complimentary bread.

name: Brunello Ristorante Italiano
review description: What a great little restaurant! Wonderful spread of cheeses, salamis, olives,etc served as appetizer and my salmon was cooked perfect. Loved it. Brunellos is fairly close to my home, and I think I've found my new favorite in the area.

name: Buca di Beppo - Lynnwood
review description: Buca di Beppo is a family favorite. You always get good food and it's pretty consistant. The prices are pretty high though even though it's family style. I think they have lowered the amount of food for the higher prices. Not happy with that. It is one of the only places around that you can get veal and that's a plus. Don't like the fact that they took our favorite salad and added $2.00 to add the two ingredients that they were putting on for free before. Why didn't you just add the $2.00 to the price and not tell anyone???Not a smart move people...other than that, it was a good experience.

name: Buca di Beppo - Seattle
review description: Always a fun time. Yummy food served family style. Large portions - luckily the staff packages take-home boxes very well.

name: C.I. Shenanigans
review description: I went out for my birthday. We ate out on the deck and it was a beautiful evening. There was a band playing which was nice and added to the experience. The server was fine but not very friendly. The meal was great. I had the scallops and my husband had a steak.

name: Cafe Juanita
review description: This is a great place with outstanding service and a very different food selection and the staff is very knowledgeable. We will be back.

name: Calcutta Grill
review description: I was looking for a place to take an individual I was hosting at work. I needed a setting that was comfortable, relaxed and easy to hold a conversation. All of the above worked well.

name: Cal's Classic American
review description: the chicken and waffle was not what i expected. It was just okay. Nothing to brag about.

name: Camano Island Inn
address: 1054 SW Camano Drive Camano Island, WA  98282
review description: While Camano Island may be limited in their selection of places to dine out, what they do have are wonderful. The restaurant looks out over Saratoga Passage and Whidbey Island; what could be better. Michelle was an excellant waitperson and made our special occasion dinner even more special.

name: Canlis
review description: From being given one of the best tables in the house by owner emeritus Chris Canlis to finding our car waiting for us when we stepped outside, the evening couldn't have been more perfect. The butter-poached lobster, hamachi appetizer, and mille feuille dessert were especially memorable.

name: Capital Grille - Seattle
review description: I use to dining here, i loved the service there. But I guess depend who is going to be your waiter. I had my favorite waitress, she is very sweet and friendly. But last dining with Capital Grille. It's my Bithday fall in to the weekday. It's was slow and everything not really great like it use to be. To me the service is the number #1, good food is coming #2. Doesn't matter how good the foods are, but if you don't have a good service, it's ruin everything.

name: Casa Patron
review description: Wonderful Latin flavors...so much more than just Mexican

name: Cascina Spinasse
review description: We started with the Prosciutto di Parma with roasted and strawberries. Very good and a generous portion. Rabbit meatballs wrapped in caul fat served with tiny roasted buttered radishes was the hit of the evening. The baby lettuce starter was fresh and good but nothing exceptional. The torrone gelato terrine with honey caramel was a perfect end the evening. Nice selection of wines by the glass.

name: Cedar Steakhouse
review description: It couldn't be better. The food is outstanding with great service.

name: Cellars Restaurant & Lounge
review description: The manager was awesome and the service was great. Thank you~R

name: Chandler's Crabhouse
review description: Very fun evening Great crab and seafood. yum. Perfect for out of towners.

name: Chantanee Thai Restaurant & Bar
review description: The atmosphere was great, we had dinner outside on the terrace.We ordered chantanee soup which I highly recomend and then we have Phad Phed Gang Dang and Havenly Beef which were delicious.We'll be back again.

name: Chloé
review description: As always, the service was prompt and friendly, and the food was to die for! I like that they periodically change the menu so there are new items to try. I've never had anything there that wasn't delicious.

name: Churchill's Steakhouse
review description: Wonderful service, delicious food from the dinner roll to dessert!!!

name: Chutney's
review description: Excellent food. Best Indian resturant in Seattle area.Curried mussels were fantastic.

name: Chutneys Bistro
review description: Great food as always. We've been there many time but first time for Sunday buffet. It was great.

name: Clinkerdagger
review description: We are from California heading to a wedding in Sandpoint and someone on the plane recommended this restaurant. So pleased I would return in a minute.

name: Coho Restaurant
review description: I intended to rate the ambience as outstanding but it would not "stick."

name: Coldwater Bar & Grill
review description: The food was excellent though the menu for lunch is less extensive than it used to be.

name: Collections Cafe
review description: We had a wonderful meal and evening at Collections Cafe.It is part of the Chihuly Museum and contains many of Dale Chihuly'sunusual collections. They were fun to look at and they giveyou a booklet about each one.The biggest surprise was the food. It was delicious - my kidsespecially enjoyed the short ribs.After dinner it we went into the museum, which made it a lovelyevening all around.

name: Copperleaf Restaurant at Cedarbrook Lodge
review description: Copperleaf proved, once again to be a pleasure. We dined outside and were lucky to have a Jazz group playing (Apparently, Cederbrook has a Jazz series during the summer - could be a plus when arranging dinner). As with many good restuarant's Copperleaf focuses on locally sourced and sustainable purveyors. My porcini and fig appetizer was simply fantastic. The lamb was good, however it lacked adequate seasoning and was overcooked (medium vs. medium rare). My wife had the vegetarian main - beautifully presented, good flavors - another excellent dish. We will return again, this place continues to improve and impress; just need to season a bit better and get the meat temperature to order.

name: The Coterie Room
review description: Great (and fun) menu. Lots of diverse choices. Fun atmosphere with the perfect level of service. Friendly knowledgeable staff.

name: Crossroads Bar & Grill
address: 15600 Northeast 8th Street Suite J-1 Bellevue, WA  98008
review description: I like the neighborhood feel of Crossroads Bar & Grill, located in Bellevue's Crossroad Mall. Our meals are always well prepared, and the service is done with a smile.

name: Crow
review description: We say up at the bar near the kitchen. The chefs/cooks were super friendly and we really enjoyed talking to them. The food was almost really good. It definitely wasn't bad. There was just something missing from each dish - like when you try cooking a new dish at home and you feel you got close to the intent of the recipe but missed an important step. The pork chop was well seasoned but the farro underneath along with the vegetables were somewhat lackluster.Overall, it was good. Not great. Not bad. But it just can't compete with a place like terra plata which I would put in the same category.

name: Crush - Seattle
review description: we had a 10-course tasting menu dinner and probably 7/10 i really enjoyed, 3 dishes being the top are the scallops, salmon tartare and gnocchi. great service and attention to detail.

name: Cuoco
review description: The food was really fresh and tasty and our server was friendly and amazing. Loved the outdoor seating option on a rare warm summer evening in Seattle.

name: Cutters Crabhouse
review description: This restaurant definitely caters to tourists. I felt the food was good, but nothing special. I felt that it was over priced. In my opinion, Etta's across the street is much better for about the same prices.

name: Dahlia Lounge
review description: Our waitress was a bit haughty, we ordered drinks and bread before lunch. We had to ask about the bread which arrived moments before our lunch. Would have preferred to have the bread with our drinks. Otherwise, it was a good lunch; great food!

name: Daily Grill - Seattle
review description: The food was great,as usual. The Chicken Pot Pie is a show stealer and has been one of our favorites for years. I would highly recommend that one tries it.A great evening.

name: Daniel's Broiler - Bellevue
review description: Staff was attentive and paid attention to Open Table reservation.

name: Daniel's Broiler - Lake Union
review description: We had a great time, and our friend from NY said it was his best meal ever!

name: Daniel's Broiler - Leschi
review description: A favorite haunt with my dad. The best steaks in Seattle.

name: The Davenport Signature Buffet
review description: The breakfast buffet is worth the 7 hour drive. It is fun and elegant. My 16 year old daughter and I both feel special when we are here. The food is as exceptional as the presentation.

name: The Dining Room at Salish Lodge & Spa
review description: greeting staff and serving staff were outstanding. they all played along very well to help surprise my husband for his 65th birthday.

name: Dockside Bistro
review description: Pricey and menu was limited, but what we had (halibut and salmon and salads) was very good. Not great, but very good. Nice view of the marina and service was very good also.

name: El Gaucho - Bellevue
address: 450 108th Avenue Northeast City Center Plaza Bellevue, WA  98004
review description: Impeccable service and great food. Went with the carved porterhouse for two. Great concept and great taste. We did medium rare and that was the way to go. Wicked Shrimp for an appetizer was key. We'll be back!

name: El Gaucho - Seattle
review description: What can I say, expensive, but worth EVERY dollar. Finest steak in a long time

name: El Gaucho - Tacoma
review description: This is one of the premier steak houses in the Northwest. Food is always excellent as is the service. The only complaint is the price.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
review description: This was amazing place to eat! The service by Kat was unbelievable. She was the best server that I have ever had!

name: emmer & rye
address: 1825 Queen Anne Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
review description: This was our first visit to e&r and we were celebrating our anniversary to we were ready to splurge. The cocktails were delicious. Quite possibly the best manhattan ever, according to my husband. We had charcuterie to start. The server made excellent an excellent recommendation of the coppola. I ordered the pork shoulder and my his and had the pasta with mushrooms and snap peas. The portions were appropriate for single servings and everything was incredibly flavorful. I wish I could prepare a carrot the way they do at e&r! Anyway, all of the staff was very friendly, the outdoor seating was enjoyable and felt like we were somewhere special. I'm not sure how I feel about the prices and portions but it is high quality food.

name: Epulo Bistro
review description: 3 different entrees all designed well good flavor but all overbooked by cook. Nice atmosphere. Considering price for quality not likely to return.

name: Etta's Seafood
review description: Food is always excellent at Etta's. I wasn't too fond of getting charged for bread. Our server was too serious. She didn't smile even once.

name: EVO Tapas Kitchen & Cabaret
review description: EVO is still finding its groove. The menu descriptions don't always match the food that is served which is a little annoying. Overall quality is good for the price but they need to tweak the menu and add some other options - just a little too limited. That said, it won't keep me from returning for a drink and nosh, I just won't go there expecting to have a "full" meal.

name: FareStart
review description: After dinner there was a graduation ceremony for the students who successfully completed the program. It topped of a very pleasant evening.

name: Fins Bistro
review description: Great food, good prices, worth checking out!

name: Firenze Ristorante Italiano
review description: Ok but not great. Impossible to find with. Gps.

name: Flying Fish
review description: We ordered the pan-fried halibut with corn and poblano cream, and tomatillo salsa. An amazing, delicious, satisfying dish. Service was attentive and friendly. The only (slightly) dissatisfying thing was the wine list. It was hard to find something appealing, especially by the glass. I would suggest more Washington syrahs, cabernet sauvignons and red blends. I would add a couple sauvignon blancs from New Zealand—since they do them better than almost anyone—and a seasonal rose wine from Provence. The current list seems like an afterthought, rather than much thought going into it. Otherwise, great experience.

name: Fresh Bistro
review description: Fresh Bistro is from the same people who bring Seattle Herban Feast, and it is one of a growing pantheon of superior dining choices in West Seattle. We are regulars for brunch (which they serve until 3, a full hour longer than their local competition) and we have tried pretty much everything on that menu. Don't miss the coffee cake!

name: Front Street Grill
review description: When we arrived, our table was ready even though we were early. However, the wait person did not ask for our drink order for 15 minutes - we had hoped to get happy hour prices. When we inquired about happy hour, we were told that it was over even though we had been sitting there for 15 minutes.There were lots of young kids which is great if you want a place that is kid friendly. It happens that we did not. We left the restaurant without ordering.

name: Gateway to India - Gig Harbor
review description: My Dad and I came for dinner before seeing The Hunger Games movie.I am 16 and my dad is 47. He has had Indian food before, but I have not, so he let mechoose the restaurant. I eat all types of ethnic food and I am a good eater...I had a great time at Gateway To India...The food was awesome and I was able to talk with my Dad and catch up without it being too noisy. I asked Mom to make our reservation and it worked out great on Open Table! We will be back! Emily Meyer, age 16,Gig Harbor, WA

name: The Georgian
review description: The Georgian is one of my favorite places to eat in Seattle. I've had several dinners there with both excellent food and service. I was excited to take a friend there for lunch recently; expecting the same high standards of service. However, I couldn't have been more dissapointed. The service was disorganized and forgetful - I never ended up getting the drink I ordered at the beginning of my meal, and my original waiter never came back to the table. Our glasses remained empty during the meal and it took a long time to flag anyone down to even bring more water. The food was not up to the Georgian's high dinner standards either - portions were very small for the price and even the clam chowder was bland. Only worth going for dinner.

name: Gianfranco Ristorante Italiano
review description: Great environment to enjoy conversation with friends. Service was very personal and real. There was no push to hurry up and get you in and out. The end result was I enjoyed a relaxing evening out with an excellent selection of varied dishes. I definitely will have to return to try more dishes as well as the numerous wine selections. Whenever I dine, I enjoy the surprises you get when you try the specials of the day. I tried the Penne Gianfranco dish and truly enjoyed my meal with a smile.

name: Giuseppe's Al Porto
address: 21 Bellwether Way Suite A Bellingham, WA  98225
review description: Wonderful place to eat. We sat outside and enjoyed the view of the marina with many boats visible. The steak was excellent and cooked the way we like it. Great service. We live in Colorado and were in town for a wedding. This restaurant was recommended by our hotel.

name: Golden Beetle
review description: Beautifully prepared, fabulously flavorful -- everything!

name: Graces 5
review description: Outdoor tables too low but other than that it was great. I loved the Fetuccini Alfredo

name: Grazie Ristorante - Canyon Park
address: 23207 Bothell - Everett Hwy SE Bothell, WA  98021
review description: As always, a great evening out at Grazie! Staff is wonderful and the food terrific. We will be back!

name: Grazie Ristorante - Southcenter
review description: The wine was tasty, the lamb was delicious and the desert was yummy. The ambiance was great.

name: Greenlake Bar & Grill
address: 7200 E Greenlake Dr. N Seattle, WA  98115
review description: We felt truly welcomed when we entered the restaurant. The guy who welcomed us was also our server, and he was equally good at that role. The tomato basil soup was the best I've ever had. I'd love to get the recipe. The hamburger sliders were very good--so filling that I took one and a half of the three home. I want to go back and get one of the great sounding desserts--maybe just for dessert and coffee.

name: Harborside by McCormick and Schmick's
review description: The dining experience overall was a good one but I, and my friends, felt that we weren't taken seriously because of our youth. Money is money, and whether I'm spending it at your establishment or at another makes no difference to me. Stop treating youth as if we're not valid patrons. Beyond that, the view was spectacular and I could happily eat your food all day long, it was delicious.

name: Harissa Mediterranean Cuisine
review description: something new.... food was great. They do have an outside eating area - went there for lunch on a sunny day it was great being out doors. Liked the food , went back for a dinner. TRY IT !!!

name: Hi-Life
review description: I haven't been to hi-life since I've had kids and it's because I remembered being a nicer restaurant than a kid-friendly place would be. I require a lot of friendliness because I have 2-year-old twins. But, a friend told me it's actually very kid-friendly and they were right! We had a great time and the food and wine were very good.

name: Hoist House Restaurant at Swiftwater Cellars
address: 301 Rope Rider Drive Cle Elum, WA  98922
review description: Bit of a train wreck. Waited 45 minutes for food and it was not ready to be served. Clearly a problem with the kitchen but made worse by the server. Surly, outwardly hostile about the delay. Towards us? Towards the kitchen? Hard to tell leaving us extremely uncomfortable. Had to cancel resi for next night. Comped two entries but treated us poorly at the same time. Note to establishment. Don't refund customer money AND make them mad.

name: Hook & Plow
review description: Noisy! Good food, but don't plan on having a conversation.

name: How To Cook A Wolf
address: 2208 Queen Ann Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
review description: great food and service, music too loud first hour but then turned down for dinner at 6:30 PM.

name: Hunger
review description: The tapas for dinner was excellent--the preparations were unusual and creative. Would certainly go back for lunch or dinner !

name: The Hunt Club
review description: Our server was attentive, but unobtrusive, which was important to our group. Everyone was pleased with their meal selection.

name: I Love Sushi on Lake Bellevue
review description: Wow! What a find! Everything from the location to food to service was amazing..I will more than definitely return to this location.

name: Icon Grill
review description: Had the mac n cheese with bbq pork that was supposedly a 'winner' of some contest. Unfortunately, couldn't finish the whole thing. Tasted like it came from a box aside from the bbq pork. The fried chicken was very good.

name: Il Bistro
review description: We were very pleased with Il Bistro,we requested a quiet table preferebly in a corner for we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and we were very pleased when we arrived. The service,food and atmosphere was very good,no complaints,would definately go there again.

name: Il Fornaio - Seattle
review description: We were a group of 14 and had a great meal, excellent service and a fun night thanks to the whole team at Il Fornaio Seattle. Special thanks to Lee for making our night super!

name: Il Terrazzo Carmine
review description: I loved my appetizer and main course-- the veggies were really flavorful! My husband loved his steak.

name: Indochine Asian Dining Lounge
review description: I have been going here for years. It is a great place with great food and excellent service. This is always the #1 place I recommend to people.

name: Ivar's Acres of Clams
review description: Seemed like any other chain restaurant with no attention to personal attention. Everyone was brought in with a buzzer that ignored the reservations that we had. Request for a windowside table were denied even thought there were two empty tables cleaned and ready.The seafood was fresh and good, and was certainly worth it.

name: Ivar's Mukilteo Landing
review description: Great as usual. If you are looking for a place to celebrate something special it is your destination. The food is simply great, servers are friendly and the view behind the window is spectacular.On the other hand you can admit necessity to book in advance to have good table.

name: Ivar's Salmon House
review description: Very good food and service, lovely view, very noisy.

name: Jacobi's Cafe
review description: 3 generations went there for the All You Can Eat Spaghetti and Meatballs. There wasn't just one type of sauce, but 4! And choice of meatballs or italian sausage. Salad and bread included. The food was wonderful! The service was great! It was a hot day, we were there in late afternoon, and were able to sit outside, in the shade. The ambience was perfect for everyone. Totally recommend Jacobi's to anyone looking for fantastic food and service!

name: Japonessa
review description: We were running late and had tickets for the symphony later that night. The server did everything to make sure we got our food quickly and got to our show on time. There was no stress, because we knew she was on top of it. It was great service and the food was really good!

name: John Howie Steak
review description: The best Steakhouse in Seattle and one of the best in the US. Beautiful and romantic dining room, outstanding food and service!

name: Julia's of Wallingford
review description: Julia's is a quaint bistro with friendly service and a nice variety on the menu!

name: Julia's on Broadway
review description: Subpar food, mediocre service. The only plus was that the show Le Faux was great. Any decent restaurant should take Amex... hint hint hint. Once the waiter took his shirt off things got much better.

name: JUNO
review description: Everything was of the highest quality. Made a lunch reservation for 3 & they had a table already set up.

name: Kingfisher Restaurant and Wine Bar at Sleeping Lady
review description: It is an incredible to find a restaurant that maintains high quality food in an area where tourists flock. The King Fisher restaurant added an incredible place to eat in a special resort at the Sleeping Lady. The food and wine selection are outstanding, the buffet style is different compared to the typical buffets in Las Vegas, the server made sure that food are not wasted yet everyone will have plenty of opportunity to have seconds, thirds, etc. and still maintain fresh food. There is no doubt in my mind return here pretty soon and recommend this restaurant, and Sleeping Lady Resort, to others who seeks a combination of relaxation, wilderness, and exellent food.

name: Koral Bar & Kitchen
address: 900 Bellevue Way NE, Suite 100 Bellevue, WA  98004
review description: We were there for a special occasion but there was no attention given by staff. Food was good and our waitress was prompt, but everything felt a bit "flat".

name: La Bete
review description: Food was ok, would not recommend it to a foodie.

name: La Lot Restaurant and Bar
review description: Took my mother for Mother's Day and we had a very nice meal. We had the green papaya salad and the scallops wrapped in Betel leaves--both good and the papaya salad was a big portion. For entrees, we shared the short ribs in wine--these were very tasty but a little too fatty. We also had the pork/shrimp in clay pot--this was excellent but the shrimp were a little overcooked but I would totally have this again. The other dish was the garlic green beans which were excellent. Will totally return. We actually recommended Lo Lot to a local resident walking past the front door as we were leaving :)

name: Lake Forest Park Bar & Grill
address: 17535 Ballinger Way NE Lake Forest Park, WA  98155
review description: I found the food tasteless and bland. I had the Buttermilk Chicken, the thigh was still red in the middle, the potatoes I could have hung paper with. The slaw was passable. My daughter had Beef Stroganoff. It was nothing more than a few chunks of meat(?)on over- done noodles. The wine was good tho.

name: Lakeside Bistro
review description: A diamond in the rough ... what a gem to find hidden along Rainier Avenue.

name: Laredos Grill
review description: Food was great. Mango Margarita a big hit.

name: Le Grand Bistro Americain
review description: Great view of Lake Washington, Steak Poivre was delish.

name: Library Bistro
review description: The service was amazing and will keep me coming back! The decor was super cute and one of a kind. The brunch we had was good, but not amazing.

name: Lighthouse Bar & Grill
review description: The sea scallops dish was superb, the best I've ever tasted!

name: Little Boston Bistro - The Point Casino
review description: What a terrific surprise! Everything was wonderful. The food, service, decor. Did I mention the food? Wow. The best steak, Alaskan King crab legs, French onion soup, yum... We will be back. Once seated, you would never know you were at a casino.

name: Lobster Shop South
review description: It was tasty food, artfully arranged!

name: Local 360 Cafe & Bar
review description: Very cool idea! Food was a little dissapointing. It was under seasoned and three of us ordered steaks cooked medium, we got one med well, one med rare, and one cooked perfectly. I got braised rabbit leg that certainly did not seem braised it was actually kind of tough and seemed undercooked. We loved the look it has a very warm and rustic feel. The beer and spirit list is impressive we will certainly go back for a drink and some of their amazing frits.

name: Lola Seattle
review description: First time visiting Lola and I'm so glad that we did. The service was great as well as the food. Of course you must try the donuts, they are as good as you have heard.

name: Lot No. 3
review description: Pleasant service. Really bland salad (Pulled chicken). Dark inside, cramped table against a post, ambiance is cold metal feeling.

name: Luc
review description: What a remarkable way to celebrate Bastille Day, with a FABULOUS meal, great service and marvelous wine! We had the 3 COURSE PRIX FIX Dinner. I began the meal with the smoked salmon tartine which was amazing, and my partner had the pate with apricot, that he still is raving about! We both had the shrimp/sausage entree that was both hearty and flavorful, and the meal ended with a delicious almond cake,vanilla pastry cream,cherry compote and an absolutely amazing chocolate mousse! Thank you for making Saturday such a special event.

name: Lucia
review description: Was busy for a Friday night. Restaurant tends to get loud with both the noise of the customers and the music from the sound system. On our OpenTable reservation, we requested to sit on the patio. Unfortunately, when we checked in, a table hadn't been reserved for us outside. Slightly disappointed as we were seated near the patio so we got to watch the lucky patrons outside.

name: Luna Restaurant
review description: First visit to Luna and it was one of the best restaurants we have visited this year (including restaurants in Sonoma, Santa Fe and Seattle).The outdoor dining was lovely and the inside dining very beautiful and reminded me of being in someone's upscale home. Luna had an outstanding wine list that was extremely well priced, the cocktail list diverse and all ingredients fresh, plus the food was wonderful with a great menu.

name: Ma’ono Fried Chicken & Whisky 'formerly Spring Hill'
review description: Our first visit and definitely not our last! Excellent fried chicken and the best homemade kimchee! So many items on the menu are homemade. Our next visit will include the Cheeseburger! And a special shout out to Mai our server who was delightful!

name: Maggiano's - Bellevue
review description: The staff was attentive and downright charming, and the food was outstanding as always. We told them what time we needed to be done by in order to catch our movie, and they took care of us with plenty of time to spare, without anything feeling rushed. And it's hard to beat going home with a "tomorrow pasta" as well!

name: The Majestic Cafe
review description: Great food, great service - our go to restaurant (weekly)!

name: Mamma Melina
review description: The food is totally fine, even good, but not amazing - but I think that the restaurant makes up in ambiance and convenience what it may lack in deliciousness. I liked it a lot and it seems reliable - I would feel comfortable bringing out-of-town guests here. Very hip - good bar, good happy hour (for both food and drinks), nice outdoor lounge/patio, free and easy-to-find parking.

name: Manhattan Seattle
review description: The steaks are amazing here at Manhattan Seattle; however service is sub-par. Our party of 3 was seated prior to two other groups showing up. We all ordered at the same time and our meals came out after the meals of the later parties. We ended up waiting for almost 40 minutes before our food showed up. Lame.

name: Maple Leaf Grill - Seattle
review description: Really good foon, chairs could be more comfortable, but everyone was very happy with fDinner!

name: Marcela's Creole Cookery
review description: The food was very tasty with good flavors. The waiter was excellent and gave good recommendations. We were spoiled with lots of attention since we were the only ones in the restaurant at the time (we dined early that day due to a commitment). I would definitely go back and would recommend it to anyone if you like Cajun/Creole food.

name: Margaux - Warwick Hotel, Seattle
review description: This restaurant was a pleasant surprise. The food was extremely good, the portions were generous and the three-course dinner for $30 is a good value. The atmosphere was casual and welcoming and our server was very friendly and accommodating.

name: Mariposa at Neiman Marcus - Bellevue
address: 11111 NE 8th Street Level Two Bellevue, WA  98004
review description: We had excellent food and impeccable service. Not only did our waiter know the ingredients of everything we asked about, but he gave good service.

name: Marjorie Restaurant
review description: This was my wife and I's first time at Marjorie. We truly enjoyed the foood experience -- several unusual items on the menu as well as some standard fare, and a great, friendly service. The patio is tucked away jus stepts from the street but it doesn't fell at all like you are eating on the sidewalk. We've been looking for a local gem and we have found it. We will definitely be going back inthe coming weeks.

name: Masselow's - Northern Quest Resort & Casino
address: 100 N. Hayford Rd Airway Heights, WA  99001
review description: Very nice menu.Had mussels,clams-very nice,were excellent with the Schramsberg.Pheasant and lamb entrees-very nice. Surprisingly Good wine selections. Pleasant,friendly service. Good ambiance. Thank you for the lovely evening!

name: Maximilien
review description: Interesting and excellent prix fixe for Bastille Day. Accompanying wine flight was well chosen and good value.

name: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Bellevue
review description: My wife and I were celebrating our birthdays and selected McCormick & Schmick in order to have seafood. Our meal was well timed,the wine selection was good,the meal was hot and the portions were plentiful.I am sure we will go back.

name: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Seattle
review description: Met a dear friend for lunch. Greeting and the table given was fine. Waitress was a bit snippy and just flopped things on the table. Regretfully, I still tipped her well out of empathy, not fir good service. Will not be going back to that restaurant - there are lots of other choices.

name: McCormick's Fish House - Seattle
review description: Consistently good. Never a shortage of fresh seafood choices.

name: Melrose Grill
review description: Steaks were over cooked and under dressed. First time in years that I was disappointed with our meals.

name: The Melting Pot - Bellevue
review description: My wife and I visited the Melting Pot for our 2nd anniversary and made a reservation in advance. The waitstaff was friendly and helpful and we were greeted at our table with a card congratulating us on our anniversary and offering us $10 off our next meal there. After the best meal I've had in months, we were given two complimentary glasses of champagne. I strongly recommend the Melting Pot for your special occassion.

name: The Melting Pot - Seattle
review description: The melting pot was delicious. The chocolate fondue was especially amazing.

name: The Melting Pot - Tacoma
review description: Awesome food and excellent service!

name: The Metropolitan Grill
review description: Great experience - the food was great ! We were amazed at the presentation of the Châteaubriand for Two and I saw everyones jaw around us drop at the table presentation, so apparently it was also quite the show! My beautiful girlfriend and I enjoyed excellent service, top quality food and overall it was an amazing wonderful experience.

name: Mistral Jewel Box
review description: Excellent pacing of courses! A delightful experience for our party of 5. It was quiet so conversation was easily heard. The wine pairings were the perfect choice for the courses

name: Mistral Kitchen
review description: The entire experience at Mistral Kitchen was a memorable one - from its lively atmosphere to attentive service to memorable food. When one of the two bottles of wine we selected was unavailable, the chef/owner personally came to our table with a sample of alternate recommendation. Our group of four sampled four different entrees and each offered the ideal mix of flavors and textures with two sublime desserts capping off a delicious evening.

name: Momiji Restaurant
review description: Best sushi I've had in Seattle!

name: Monas Bistro
review description: Was very disappointed with the food. The caesar salad was very dry with very little parmesan and almost no flavor - even after asking for and adding an extra side of dressing. The prawn linguine was tasteless. Very little flavor in the pesto like sauce and the shrimp were bland with no taste. We had been to Mona's a few times before, but after this experience we will never be back.

name: Montalcino Ristorante Italiano
review description: Being from the NYC area, my standards for good Italian are pretty high. This is not your usual fare - the sauce was bright, the lasagna, chicken, and vegetables cooked perfectly. Definitely a date night repeat for us!

name: Morton's The Steakhouse - Seattle
review description: Morton's is one of our favorite Restaurants that we go to, we always get great service and exceptionally great food

name: Nijo Sushi Bar & Grill
review description: Service was slow and our waitress messed up our bill. The lemon drop martini at the bar was incredibly week. I would not dine here again.

name: Nordstrom - The Grill - Bellevue
review description: We enjoy the menu at the grill. The fresh specials are always good.

name: Nordstrom - The Grill - Seattle
review description: The woman who greets you is wonderful, our service was terrific, and we all loved our food choices. I had grilled salmon over little grilled vegetables and it was delicious!!

name: The Olive & Grape
review description: Great food! Service wasn't stellar as the place was really busy and only one server. Tried the O and G because of Seattle Restaurant Week. Will def come back. Their lamb meatballs were wonderful.

name: Olympia Pizza II Wallingford
review description: Food was good and the service was exceptional.

name: Osteria La Spiga
review description: I am Italian and moved to Seattle from Italy 12 years ago. This is undoubtedly the best Italian restaurant in town.Don't expect "Americanized Italian". No fettuccine Alfredo or meat balls.This is what you should expect from fine Northern Italian cuisine.Try Piadina and Gnocco Fritti, the speciality from Romagna.The Italian wine list is simply unmatchable and has great wines also at $25!

name: Over The Moon Cafe
review description: Really appreciate a place with good food, delightful decor, where you can actually converse with your dining partner.

name: Pacific Grill
review description: Perfect place for a formal business lunch.

name: Palisade
address: 2601 West Marina Place Elliott Bay Marina Seattle, WA  98199
review description: The service is excellent. Joe and Stella were great.

name: Palm Court Grill at The Davenport Hotel
address: 10 S Post Street, Suite B Spokane, WA  99201
review description: Cindy has been our waitress our last 2 visits, and we just love her!

name: Palomino - Bellevue
review description: I ordered something off the menu a year ago and it was no longer offered as their menu changes so often. The manager immediately came up to see what he could do, worked with the chef, and recreated my wonderful lemon risotto. Absolute best service I have ever experienced.

name: Palomino - Seattle
review description: The brined salmon was amazing and several of us had it and loved it. Great service an great food!! Always a terrific experience.

name: Pasta Freska
review description: We always enjoy our visits to Pasta Freska. We enjoyed a special evening for my wife's birthday. The food was very good and the special dessert with the restaurant customers and staff singing was a bonus!

name: PEARL Bar & Dining
review description: I have dined twice at Pearl. While the food is well prepared, the portion sizes are small. Someone with a larger appetite would have required 3 - 4 courses to be satisfied.

name: Peso's
address: 605 Queen Anne Ave North Seattle, WA  98109
review description: Great value for your money. Superbly prepared food and extensive drink menu

name: Petra Mediterranean Bistro
review description: Very friendly service. Really good food if you are a vegetarian. The baba ghanouj, dolma and pita were great. The wine list is quite good. The falafel was okay and the chicken was not super juicy. Portions are huge so be careful while ordering.

name: Piatti - Seattle
review description: good solid food; attracts an older Laurelhurst crowd & groups

name: Piazza's Wine Bar
review description: Great place for a girl's night out. Not too dark inside, decent food, and great wine! Will come again soon!

name: The Pink Door
review description: Sat outside. Good view. Fabulous lasagne and salmon. Casual with great food.

name: Pintxo
review description: They recently started offering a brunch menu and it is AMAZING!

name: Pizzeria Guido & Wine Bar - Bellevue
review description: We had a large party - 6 adults, 6 children. It was not a busy night at the restaurant and we were accommodated nicely, although it seems it would have been problematic on another night. Service was perfunctory but satisfactory (especially given our large size), but the food is mediocre. Would return if someone I was with wanted to go but would not suggest going there again.

name: Place Pigalle
review description: I've lunched at Place Pigalle a number of times but this was my first dinner. When I arrived, the place was nearly empty and we were a small party, so I was a little disappointed at the table we were given (I felt crowded and the view wasn't so great). I could have asked for a different table, of course.

name: Pogacha of Issaquah
review description: They don't have a huge menu, but they do everything very well. The pear ravioli is amazing, and the family size easily served 4, along with some flatbreads, we were stuffed and had leftovers.

name: Ponti Seafood Grill
review description: We had a wonderful time and a delicious meal.

name: Poppy
review description: nice...tasty...bu small portions considering how pricey....the side dishes were in thimbal size containers. 24.00 for the meal plus drinks..plus coffee and desert....gets pricey for that kind of casual dining.

name: Poquitos
review description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in town. Only complaint this time was that the noise was the loudest I've ever heard it there and we couldn't hear each other across the table. But that's not always the case here. Great food and service, as always.

name: Portals Restaurant at Suncadia Resort
review description: We had to wait for our food for about 45 minutes after we ordered. The food then came out cold. Our waitress comped our dessert, but that took another half hour to receive. Great tasting food, but very slow kitchen. Our waitress tried her hardest to make up for it.

name: Post
review description: An enjoyable place a bit off the beaten path. We had a group of 8 adults and kids and all agreed it was a very good, relatively inexpensive spot that had menu offerings for all to enjoy.

name: Prelude at McCaw Hall
review description: The food was good. Had the seafood chowder and the asparagus with the poached egg. Both were delicious; the sauce under the asparagus had sort of a strange color. Great light meal before a performance. The wine list is overpriced, especially if you just want one glass.

name: Preservation Kitchen
review description: Had a business lunch. Unfortunately, a large party took a table next to ours and the noise echoing off the hard surfaces makes it difficult to carry on a serious conversation. There is a back dining room which should have been used in the first place; much quieter. The menu looked pretty good and original. However, the Caesar salad I ordered is not work a repeat. Because of the large party, our server was unable to keep our coffee refilled or otherwise pay much attention to us. The bar area looks good and I'd go back for that.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Bellevue
review description: Our group found the space really loud, and the service very inconsistent.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Kirkland
review description: Great Salad and fish entrees! Always enjoy coming back here. Their daily special menus are always changing and is just fantastic.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Seattle
review description: The restaurant was very lively, I almost consider it to be loud. The restaurant is a large open (mostly table and chair, no dividers) room with a lot of people and sound reflective surfaces, you have to expect the noise. The sound didn't take away from the experience, the energy in the room was at a pleasing level and since it was so open it was nice to see all the wine bottles across all of the tables. Strong dark style with large windows that provide a very decent amount of natural light during the day and toward the evening. The food was very tasty, executed well, but could use a little something more. The menu was very accessible with a selection of "cafe" style foods that had a higher class spin applied in order to match the atmosphere

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Woodinville
address: 14459 Woodinville Redmond Road NE Woodinville, WA  98072
review description: The Woodinville Purple restaurant is a warm and friendly destination that is woven into the fabric of the community. The staff is welcoming, friendly, and always attentive to making making the customer happy.

name: Ravish
review description: We went here as a result of all the reviews we had seen on Open Table.

name: Ray's Boathouse
review description: With restaurants opening and closing in Seattle with dizzing speed, the established classics sometimes get left out of mind. Ray's Boathouse maintains its status of one of Seattle's finest restaurants. Discrete service, amazing wine list, comfortable yet not dowdy atmosphere. Ray's Boathouse is in the pentacle of Seattle cuisine.

name: Ray's Cafe
review description: We have eaten at Ray's Boathouse a number of times and enjoyed it, but had never eaten at the Cafe. We took out of town friends, and we all enjoyed it. One guest said it was the best chowder he'd eaten. We're not usually fans of the whole 'small plate' concept, but the small plate salmon and halibut with a salad turned out to be perfect for several of us, and the Ahi tuna salad was very good. Overall, a nice first time there and I'm sure we'll return.

name: Re:public
review description: Great spot for a wonderful meal in a very causal setting. Bar setting but quiet. The burgers and fries are out of this world but we also had pate and halibut and a wonderful little keylime tart. Great for anyone looking for a casual unpretentious meal but with nicely prepared food. Small menu--good, beer , wine, and drink selections. Nice bread!

name: Red Fin Restaurant
review description: Red Fin was average at best. The place was empty (although it was early in the evening) and they appeared to be struggling from just recently getting their liquor license back. They only had one server working and this made the pace slow because he had to wait on everyone (only three or four tables in the whole place were occupied, however). The sushi was just ok. The sashimi tasted reasonably fresh, but I have had much better tasting sashami before. The rolls seemed uninspired--looking like something out of a grocery store case. It was fine for a reasonably quick early dinner, but we didn't feel like we made a very good choice with all of the options in this town know for its fish.

name: Red House
review description: This was my 3rd time coming here, and I was taking my nephew for his HS graduation dinner. The other two times the food was great. We had the steamed clams and a tomato, basil and mozzarella bruschetta to start. The bruschetta was good, but the steamed clams were rubbery. My nephew ordered the lasagna special and loved it. I had the salmon, and unfortunately it was over-cooked and a bit dry. For desert I had the lava cake, which I also had the other two times I'd eaten here. The other two times the chocolate oozed out of the cake. This time, it was pretty much cooked all the way through...I don't know if they just had an off night. I really hope so because this is one of my favorate places to eat...I'll still give it another try.

name: The Restaurant at Alderbrook
review description: My wife and I celebrated our 26th anniversary last Thursday, July 12th at the Alderbrook Restaurant. Everything was wonderful, the food was delicious as were the drinks, the waitress was friendly and helpful, the ambiance and view were great. We had a wonderful time and will definitly go back again.

name: Restaurant Bea
review description: Lovely neighborhood spot; great service. Lively for a weeknight.

name: Restaurant Zoe
review description: It was a lovely dinner with great drinks and dishes.

name: The Rhododendron Restaurant
review description: Loved the Rhododendron Restaurant while staying at the Inn at Virginia Mason for a family wedding.We ate dinner once and breakfast twice and everything was delicious and the service was excellent---thank you!!

name: Ricardo's Restaurant
review description: This was our Anniversary dinner, and Ricardos made it special.

name: Ristorante Italianissimo
review description: Visiting from Denver and found this gem. Great food & service, try it!!

name: RN74 - Seattle
review description: Our party had a big booth by the window which was perfect for our lunch meeting. Service was attentive and gracious. Two of us had the special of the day--a crab, avocado, and heirloom tomato salad. The portions were small but we were given bread on request. One of my colleagues ordered the fish and chips and found the fish to be somewhat "mushy"--the waiter offered to replace with another dish but we were pressed for time.Would like to give it a try for dinner.

name: Rock Bottom Brewery - Seattle
review description: Not a bad pub food restaurant, but nothing spectacular. They forgot an appetizer and acted like they were making a concession taking it off our bill. We just chalked that to a miscommunication.

name: Rover's
review description: Absolutely brilliant service, the sommelier and all front of staff had exceptional customer service. The food was almost perfect, just found the fish a little floury could be a little fresher. But other than that it was just amazing, the best restaurant in Seattle by far!

name: Rumblefish Sushi
address: 20109 Aurora Ave N Suite 101 Shoreline, WA  98133
review description: very good sushi, rolls, sides. Nice atmosphere, very friendly and responsive staff. Generous portions as well.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Bellevue
review description: Disappointed for once... maybe because of father's day rush? Way too much butter!!

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Seattle
review description: We had the Porter House for 2 and it was outstanding. Worth every penny. The wedge salad was OK. Next time I would just order the dinner salad with blue cheese dressing on the side. Service and wine were very good.

name: Rview
review description: Quite nice. Very good and authentic Italian food. If just two are dining ask to sit at the two seat area overlooking the chefs.

name: Safari Room Fresh Grill and Bar
address: 111 South Post Street Ste. E Spokane, WA  99201
review description: The Safari Room was lovely. Beautiful architecture, great area with booths, and very quiet too. The 3 course dinner for $15, was amazing. We had the teriyaki salmon, with rice, and fresh small green beans, with a caesar salad, followed by a small but FABULOUS creme brûlée, plenty for me. Just a great experience. We had a wonderful up-beat, fun waiter, Andrew, who made the whole time just a great ending for our vacation.

name: Salty's at Redondo Beach
address: 28201 Redondo Beach Drive South Des Moines, WA  98198
review description: Friendly service, and the best seafood ever! It took a while for our entrees to arrive, but that's the only negative thing i have to say.

name: Salty's on Alki
review description: The food was great, the staff was friendly, and the view was amazing! But the service was SO SLOW! We were not in a hurry...but EVERYTHING seemed to take forever! We had a nice time...but I don't think we would rush back.

name: Savory Restaurant & Lounge
review description: We were there celebrating our son's 20th Birthday so baby grandson was in attendance as well. Our Waitor was very attentive but not annoying. The food was fabulous! I had the fish and chips with sweet pototo fries and slaw. Those were the best sweet pototatoes I have ever eaten. My daughter had the pot pie and loved it. Everyone in our group raved about the food and the desserts! We got the Spoko deal for 15.90. Soup/salad, main course and dessert. What a deal. I can not say enough good things about our experience.

name: Sazerac
review description: This is my first time at Sazerac in years, and I was more than pleased. A few months ago, my wife had raved about the cheese plate, and it certainly lived up to expectations. The cheese was served with slices of crisp pear, a wonderful grilled flatbread, and a relish/fruit compote with berries and other fruit. In addition, the grits with roasted carrots and spring vegetables was simply divine. The service was excellent and the room was open and comfortable. And it was all very reasonably priced. We will be back soon.

name: The Scarlet Tree
review description: Disappointed with the food. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't good.

name: The Scotch and Vine
address: 22341 Marine View Dr. S. Des Moines, WA  98198
review description: This was the third time we have eaten at Scotch and Vine and all three have been great experiences. Top-notch drinks, outstanding cheese selection and really well done food at a reasonable price will keep us coming back.

name: Scott's Bar & Grill
review description: I've been dining here since it was "Klinken Dagger Pittstaff and Pits". It's outstanding! Don't forget to order the pea salary - it's wonderful.

name: Seastar Restaurant & Raw Bar
review description: There were four in our group and three of us ordered the Ancho Chili Smoked Steelhead. Wow, this dish was pronounced the best fish I have ever had by two of our diners and the third loved it as well. The layers of flavor were so spectacular. Not just the fish but also the wonderful potato/corn cake that accompanied this dish. The other diner in our group got a mushroom dish and also loved it.

name: Seastar Restaurant and Raw Bar - Seattle
review description: Our dinner at Seastar was an amazing experience. The food was superb and the service excellent. As with most Seattle restaurants it is a bit noisy. The atmosphere is elegant and there were well behaved children at one table. I would not say it is family friendly unless your children are good in upscale restaurants. However, I would return to Seastar in a heartbeat.

name: Serafina
review description: We went to Serafina for my boyfriend's birthday and it was excellent. We sat on the back patio, which was perfect - great atmosphere. The food was very good, and being italian, I am particular. The bruschetta appetizer and lasagna were the right portions and tasty, not drowned in oil and butter (like some italian places do). The service was also excellent, very friendly and we were never rushed despite being a busy Saturday night. The somalier brought a bottle of wine not on the list based on my description of the types of wines I like, and it was a fine choice. Overall it was a positive experience and I'm looking forward to going back!!

name: Shalimar Restaurant - Seattle
review description: 1 of us had great food. 1 of us didn't.

name: Ship Canal Grill
review description: Surprisingly good Greek salad and Gyros-style lamb and pita. We'll be back.

name: Shuckers
review description: A bit too pricey for setting and food quality.

name: Sip Restaurant - Issaquah
review description: A favorite spot for us, we decided on SIP for our anniversary dinner. It always feels like a special occasion even though we often just meet friends for a glass of wine and conversation.

name: Six Seven Restaurant & Lounge
review description: I'm not one to write reviews, but our experience was flat out horrible and needs to be shared. Our party of six had an 830pm reservation. At 730 we sat down outside for a cocktail before dinner. Literally 15 minutes went by before we grew frustrated enough that our out of town guest went to the bar to order our drinks while we sat. The server came by a minute later. After we informed her that we had someone in line at the bar she went up to him, asked him to sit down, and we sat for another five minutes before she came back to take our drink order. Why she didn't take our drink order right when she asked him to go sit down was beyond us. Opentable will cut this review short, but the dinner service wasn't any better. Stellar food though.

name: SkyCity Restaurant at the Space Needle
review description: The stunning view makes this a worthwhile trip. Most of our food was quite good, but the steak turned out terribly. It was too bad because the rest of the experience was very enjoyable. If you go for the views, make sure you get a table by the window. There are a few interior tables and I'd have been really disappointed to be stuck there. As it was, the slow turning of the restaurant offered spectacular views uninterrupted by the bars of the observation deck, so the restaurant is really an awesome place to get the whole Space Needle effect. Go for the 360 degree vistas and choose your food carefully.

name: Sorrento Ristorante - Chelan
review description: I've been to Tsillan Cellars in the past, and fell in love with it. I really looked forward to trying out their new restaurant. The weekend after the 4th (notably busy for Chelan), I took 10 of my friends out there from Seattle. This was definitely the highlight of my trip! The patio seating was large, but they still managed to keep their intimate ambiance. I hoped to do a tasting before our reservation, and called before to ask how early we should get there. They suggested we give ourselves at least a half hour before dinner. Unfortunately, it was difficult getting 11 people coordinated and on time, so we only got there with 5 minutes to spare. The manager was very understanding, and let us do a tasting, even though it was very busy!

name: SOUTH
review description: Great waiter,excellent food and a fun atmosphere.

name: Spazzo Italian Grill & Wine Bar
review description: We stopped at Spazzo's on a Wednesday evening. We were greeted nicely and seated outside right away - the restaurant was not that busy. Our waiter seemed a little preoccupied. It was a while before we saw him and he had to have us repeat each order over. He did get everything right though and the food was very tasty - and nice an hot - always difficult at outside tables.

name: Spencer's
address: Hilton Seattle Airport 17620 International Boulevard Seattle, WA  98188
review description: Suprisingly outstanding Steak house near Seatac airport.

name: Spencer's for Steaks and Chops - Doubletree Hotel Spokane
address: 322 N Spokane Falls Ct Spokane, WA  99201
review description: This was our first trip to Spokane and we definitely chose the right restaurant. It sits along the river and a beautiful park. The Spencer Steak (ribeye) was great and so was Elk Chop. Service was attentive but not intrusive. The 3 of us easily shared the bread pudding.

name: Spice Room - Seattle
address: 4909 Rainier Ave S Suite 102 Seattle, WA  98118
review description: Love the food, very authentic and full of taste. A stand-out in a city full of Thai restaurants. The only draw-back is the service. I have been several times. They need just one more server. The owner is the bartender, takes orders and rings people up...very difficult to do all those things quickly and efficiently. Needless to say, it's not the quickest service in the world. It is always friendly, though. I am hoping this is all improving, as the last time I was there, it was better.

name: Spur Gastropub
review description: creative and subtly complex. masterful use of high-end techniques for interesting and harmonious dishes. one of my top ten meals ever.

name: Stanford's - Northgate
address: 401 NE Northgate Way Ste. 1106 Seattle, WA  98125
review description: Been to Stanford's four times. Never a bad experience.

name: Stanford's - Southcenter
review description: Good for happy hour in the bar. Restaurant itself was pretty boring.

name: Stanley & Seafort's
review description: Wonderful, well prepared and presented dishes are served here. Service is top-notch. Both seafood dishes that we had were cooked perfectly and accompanied with complementary side dishes. Plus, if you are lucky enough, you will be seated by the window for a wonderful view of Tacoma and Puget Sound. A great pick for a delightful evening!

name: Staple & Fancy Mercantile
review description: We had the fix price menu which was very good. Great selection of small plates offered and it was fun being surprised by what the chef had decided for us. The starters were great and varied; the pasta dish tasty. We thought the entree was small ... 3 scallops to be split between the 2 of us, delicious but not enough. The ricotta cheesecake for dessert was also good but again not a very large piece. The food was excellent and we did have a wonderful meal.

name: The Steak House at Silver Reef HOTEL - CASINO - SPA
review description: The steak house is wonderful! The service is top notch and the tenderloin with the chef's steak butter was undeniably the best steak I have ever had!

name: Steelhead Diner
review description: Right in the heart of tourist town a place withn real food integrity.

name: Sullivan's Steakhouse - Seattle
review description: The service was outstanding and the wine list was excellent. Food was good, however, slightly salty for my taste (both the steak and side dishes).

name: Summit House Restaurant - Seattle
review description: The best dining experience ever!

name: Sushi Joa
review description: I took my department of 7 to lunch and we were seated a couple of tables pushed together that were normally sit 6. We didn't really have enough table space to make it comfortable. The restuarant is small and is better suited for groups of 4 or less. The sushi rolls, bento, tempura, and teriyaki were very good. Wait staff was OK. Since our table was so small, it would have been nice if the wait staff were more proactive to remove unnecessary dishes and garbage. But I would go back (by myself or 1 other person).

name: Sushi Kappo Tamura
review description: Outstanding! THe best Sushi in the Northwest. Taichi is a master.

name: T. Maccarone's
review description: After years of searching for just the right place to celebrate our anniversary, this is it. But, we think it's so good that we now go to T. Maccarone's before each of our Walla Walla Symphony concerts.

name: Taki's Mad Greek
review description: We were here on a night when they have live entertainment and belly dancing, so it was a lot of fun, but very loud. The food was really delicious. I don't eat meat and had the falafel plate, which in some restaurants tends to be dry; not here, it was moist and flavorful. My husband had the chicken souvlaki and it was also delicious. Portions are huge; we had leftovers, which is a bonus.

name: Talarico's
review description: Great food and service - everything was delicious.

name: Tango
review description: We've been going to Tango for years. They continue to provide an all-around excellent experience!

name: The Tantalus Restaurant
review description: Great lamb. Crear wines. Very courteous service. A bit slow, though.

name: Tap House Bellevue
review description: 160 Beers on tap is nice, but the food wasn't anything special, especially for $12+/plate.

name: Tap House Seattle
review description: I found it to be expensive and the food was not very good for the price. It was like bar food. To many types of food on the menu and not very good at any of them. Good place if you are a beer drinker, but definitely not to eat. Fist time there and wanted to take my husband and kids for something different. Website looked good but it was not what it appeared.
